description:
Buttons allow users to take actions, and make choices, with a single tap.
This component is wrapped from `@material-ui/core/Button`.
It also renders an `<IconButton />` when the "type" prop is "icon".

allowLabelCase.description: If `false`, content of the button is shown uppercase.

colorType.description:
Color of the component.
It supports the theme colors that make sense for this component.

dynamicIcon.description: Icon name from BOA icon library.

fontIcon.description:
Font icon name from font icon's library.
@ignore

fullWidth.description: If true, the button has the full width of its container.

icon.description: Custom icon element to be rendered inside the button.

iconProperties.description: Icon props that are passed to the `<Icon />` element.

mini.description: If `true`, and `variant` is `'fab'`, will use mini floating action button styling.

svgIcon.description:
SVG Icon name from material svg icon library.
@ignore

textPosition.description:
Position of the text in the button.
It assigns given position to text if button width is greater than the text width.

textStyle.description: Styles applied to the span element that wraps the children.

tooltip.description: If type is 'icon', a tooltip is generated on the icon button.

componentSize.description:
Defines size of the component. The ComponentSize constant is exported from enums.
@ignore

context.description: Defines application requirements such as localization, theme, platform.

disabled.description: If true, all component functionalities are disabled.

id.description: All components must have an id prop.

snapKey.description:
The snapKey property is used to manage snapshots of the child components.
@ignore

snapshot.description:
In our SPA, we want to keep the state of each component when a page unmounts.
And when the same page mounts again, the component mounts with the snapshot prop and
it gets the previous state.
@ignore

style.description: All components must have a style prop.

valueConstraint.description: The valueConstraint is used for validations on components like limit, required, etc.

visible.description: In the ComponentComposer, we change the visibility of the component with this prop.
